required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate ACT-132577 in Healthy Male Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Single-center, Open-label Study With 14C-radiolabeled ACT-132577 to Investigate the Mass Balance, Pharmacokinetics, and Metabolism Following Single Oral Administration to Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to investigate the rate and routes (urine and feces) of elimination of ACT-132577, and the mass balance in urine and feces

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative excretion of radioactivity in urine and feces
primary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
primary_outcome.description: 14C-radioactivity will be measured daily in urine and feces samples for determination of total radioactivity recovery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with treatment-emergent adverse events and serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 32
secondary_outcome.description: Collection of any adverse event at each dose level

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is directly derived from the observed plasma concentrations of ACT-132577 and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach Cmax (tmax) of 14C-radiolabeled ACT-132577
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: tmax is directly derived from the observed plasma concentrations of ACT-132577 and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2 is calculated from the terminal rate constant obtained from the plasma concentrations-time curves of ACT-132577 and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) of 14C-radiolabeled ACT-132577
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is defined for the time intervals from zero to time t of the last measured concentration above the limit of quantification and from zero to infinity

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of ACT-132577 and its metabolites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is directly derived from the observed plasma concentrations of ACT-132577 and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach Cmax (tmax) of ACT-132577 and its metabolites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: tmax is directly derived from the observed plasma concentrations of ACT-132577 and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal half-life (t1/2) of ACT-132577 and its metabolites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2 is calculated from the terminal rate constant obtained from the plasma concentrations-time curves of ACT-132577 and its metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) ACT-132577 and its metabolites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study treatment administration up to day 15
secondary_outcome.description: AUC is defined for the time intervals from zero to time t of the last measured concentration above the limit of quantification and from zero to infinity

arm_group.description: On Day 1, subjects will receive a single oral dose of 25 mg 14C-radiolabeled ACT-132577, administered as an oral formulation in the fasted state

intervention.description: Single oral dose of 3.7 megabecquerel (MBq) (100 microcurie [μCi]) 14C-radiolabeled ACT-132577 administered as 1 capsule of 25 mg
